p: The variance partitioning analysis shows that nitrogen-related leaf traits (except for Î´ 15N) tended to have very high intraspecific variation with >75% of variation being found within species or sites (Figure 1). A set of other traits including specific leaf area, leaf dry matter content, leaf thickness, %P, and isotope rations had intermediate intraspecific variation, ranging from 25 to 40% of variation. Finally, %C and leaf area had less than 25% of their variation at the intraspecific level (Figure 1).
